intro: Roldana tlacotepecana, commonly known as the Mexican star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking white flowers with purple markings. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its bulbs are often used in traditional medicine, though its ornamental value is its primary appeal. Roldana tlacotepecana is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained soil and full sun.
